info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 1:58PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Wayne County through 300 PM EDT... At 158 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Willis to near Carleton to near Flat Rock. Movement was northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Flat Rock around 215 PM EDT. Grosse Ile and Belleville around 230 PM EDT. Trenton around 240 PM EDT. Romulus and Wyandotte around 255 PM EDT. Taylor, Canton and Greenfield Village around 300 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Inkster, Brownstown Township, Melvindale, Gibraltar, New Boston, Sumpter Township, Riverview, Rockwood, Wayne and Willow. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
